scenario_text.value:
I have to save them from those beasts...
Kemonogami or not.

I moved separately, acting as a decoy for the
two of them.
Well we’re glad you made it out okay...
(Maybe “okay” is a stretch...)

Aside from the creatures that attacked me,
there were others that tried to save me.

Huh, so Falcomon, Agumon and the others
aren’t the only helpful ones?
Yeah! Not all of us are bad!

I can’t tell if they’re good or bad, but I
can tell the friendly ones from the hostile.
What’s he mean, “friendly ones”?
The allies, who are nice to everyone.

I’m Aoi’s friendly one!
I’m nice to her!

Thanks to them I was able to escape, but...
I think they’re already...

(So he has not only Saki and Shuuji on his mind
but also the creatures who helped him?)
(What should I say to the professor?)
Worrying won’t help.
I’m sure they’re fine.
Let’s hurry on ahead.

Worrying won’t help.
We have no idea what’s happening.

You’re so calm.
It’s a little unnerving...

You gotta stay calm in situations like this,
or else you’ll go crazy, right?
They’re fine, I’m sure. Don’t worry.
Thanks.

But I get it.
This reality is cruel.
Let’s hurry.

Whether they’re fine or it’s too late, we
will figure it all out.

You’re right. I’d be a bad scientist if my
decisions were based on imagination.
At any rate, we have to hurry.

There are footprints here, too.
Something’s weird.
Weird?
Look at the camera.

Look here and here. The footprints are
heading in different directions.
Yeah... You’re right...

But now how do we figure out which footprints
to follow?

Hmm... I’m betting this is a trap laid by
that Kemonogami that attacked us.

That thing is clever and tough.
Watch out.
So one direction is a trap?

That thing is tough.
Watch out.
